title: Trend Detection Function Block
description:
TREND_DW monitors the input X and time at the output Q to see if X incre￾ases (Q = TRUE) or X decrease (Q = FALSE). If X does not change, Q re￾mains at its last value. If X increases, the output TU gets for one cycle to
TRUE and at the output D the result X - LAST_X is displayed. If X is less
than LAST_X so TD gets TRUE for one cycle and the output D is LAST_X - X
passed. LAST_X is an internal value of the module and is the value of X in
the last cycle.
name: TREND_DW

input.name: X
input.description: The input value to be monitored for trend detection.

output.name: Q
output.description: Indicates whether the input value 'X' has changed.

output.name: TU
output.description: True if an upward trend is detected (X has increased).

output.name: TD
output.description: True if a downward trend is detected (X has decreased).

output.name: D
output.description: The difference in value between the current and last input value.
